headline: Should Slower Core Growth And M&A Reliance Require Action From Waters (WAT) Investors?
summary: Recent commentary indicates that Waters Corporation’s core business has underperformed over the past two years, with organic revenue growth trailing healthcare peers and returns on capital weakening, raising questions about the strength of its existing profit pools. An important implication is that Waters may increasingly lean on acquisitions to supplement its slower-growing core operations, potentially reshaping how it allocates capital and pursues long-term growth opportunities. We’ll now...

headline: 3 Cash-Producing Stocks Walking a Fine Line
summary: Generating cash is essential for any business, but not all cash-rich companies are great investments. Some produce plenty of cash but fail to allocate it effectively, leading to missed opportunities.
